definition: to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out

sentences.english: I've had enough of your tootle.
sentences.chinese: 我已经受够你的唠叨了。

sentences.english: She was totally fed up. There was too much attention on her for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 她是完全受够了，没有任何理由对她有那么多的关注。

sentences.english: I've just about had enough of your unpunctuality .
sentences.chinese: 你的不准时让我受够了。

sentences.english: I've had enough of the noisiness here.
Their leadership knew people were fed up of Mao style leadership.
sentences.chinese: 他们的领导知道人们受够了毛式领导风格。

sentences.english: He was really getting tired of the catcalls and the manhandling.
sentences.chinese: 他真是受够那些嘘声和毛毛躁躁的骚扰了。

sentences.english: Mr Yang would like more but his wife has had enough.
sentences.chinese: 杨先生还想再要但是他的妻子却受够了。

sentences.english: I am fed up with my sister's hand-me-downs.
sentences.chinese: 我受够了穿我姐姐的旧衣服。

sentences.english: I would not question his heart now. He was wrecked by this loss.
sentences.chinese: 我不质疑他的心理了，他已经受够打击了。

sentences.english: He got enough of that kind of treatment from Mom.
sentences.chinese: 这样的待遇，他从老妈那里已经受够了。

sentences.english: I've just about had enough of his stupidities.
sentences.chinese: 对他的愚蠢我有点受够了。

sentences.english: Under the weight of these heavy manners, let the power fall.
sentences.chinese: 受够了那些沉甸甸的重压，打倒当权派。

sentences.english: I've had enough of him constantly carping and criticizing.
sentences.chinese: 我已经受够了他不断地吃毛求疵和批评。

sentences.english: Enough, already with this mellow incense and peppermints vibe.
sentences.chinese: 够了，我受够这些薰香以及薄荷的感觉了。

sentences.english: I'm so fed up with the bland food.
sentences.chinese: 我受够了那些乏味的食物了。

sentences.english: Girls get fed up with the feminine nature of the men.
sentences.chinese: 女孩儿们更是受够了那些阴柔的娘娘腔。

definition: not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
